FacilityName: Star LPG Tank Car Storage Facility
ParentCompanyName: Sunoco Partners Marketing and Terminals, L.P.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Sunoco Partners Marketing and Terminals - Star LPG Tank Car Storage Terminal adheres to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Robbins and Star Volunteer Fire Departments as well as the Moore County LEPC, as necessary. Medical emergencies will require notification of the First Health Ambulance Company and Montgomery Memorial Hospital. This facility does not maintain a trained fire brigade or hazardous material response team on-site to respond to the small initial stages of an emergency.



The Sunoco Partners Marketing and Terminals - Star LPG Tank Car Storage Terminal is a tank car storage facility (specifically, railcar). This Risk Management Program (RMP) covers the butane storage systems only, including the associated four hundred (400) detached 33,500 gallon storage railcars on five miles of leased abandoned rail between milepost MP-311 and MP-306.



This facility's worst-case scenario is the failure of one (1) of the tank car storage system's 33,500-gallon storage tanks when filled to the greatest amount allowed resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. The facility's alternate (feasible scenario affecting off-site receptors) release scenario is a BLEVE incident involving one (1) railcar resulting in a fireball.



The Sunoco Partners Marketing and Terminals - Star LPG Tank Car Storage Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) accident prevention rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. Railcars meet the U.S. Department of Transportation Federal Railroad Administration design requirements for pressurized tank cars.



To date, this facility has never had an accident involving butane, which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property, environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in-place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Sunoco Partners Marketing and Terminals - Star LPG Tank Car S

torage Terminal's butane storage system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Star Volunteer Fire Department and request their assistance. The facility currently has no trained fire brigade or hazardous materials response team. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the fire departments (alternate departments include Biscoe, Robbins, Troy) and the Montgomery and Moore County LEPC's. SPM&T is a company that is committed to Safety.  SPM&T is always looking for ways to improve process safety systems.
